resources.string: This is where a description would go

android, emulator, adb, ant, screenshot2, bin, gen, libs, res, src, gradle, pm, lint, src/main, build/outputs, res/layout, res/values, perspective, workspace, view, plug-in, AVD, build path, SDK, ADT, DDMS, logcat, project, panel, toolbar, status bar, preview pane, project explorer, .idea folder, intellisense, module, live layout

string-array.name: toast_answers
string-array.item: "the android command lets you modify the sdk configuration, such as downloading new packages"
"the emulator command lets you modify/create VM's for you to test on, also edit those VM's settings "
"the adb command, aka Android Debug Bridge lets you connect to your phone for live testing, also lets you send commands to the phone to do things "
"the ant command helps with compiling and cleaning applicatoins "
"bin is where the compiler tosses files for compilation"
"Res stands for resource, and holds all the xml, and images needed for different screen resolutions"
"SRC stands for source, this contains code, to resources "
"Graddle is a utility that is used inside android studio as oppposed to eclipe to build applications"
"pm stands for package manager, it lets u, manage the packages you've installed "
"lint is simliar to javadoc, but for android applications"
"holds the java, res, and android manifest for use"
"resources for files that will be used for differing dpi/screen sizes"
"resource folder for strings, ints, files, etc"
"The project holds all the files related to your file to be compiled into an apk on the build phase"
"Refers to the GUI of eclipse and how its made up of many boxes"
"This is the default directory where eclipse/android studio save projects"
"View refers to what the classes used when building the Graphical User Interface"
"Plug-in's are optional(mostly) files you can install "
"Stands for Android Virtual Devices, which are the Virtual Machines used to test applications on"
"This is where the ide will put the compiled files temporarily before packaging the apk"
"Stands for Software Development Kit, eclipse or android studio are basically sdk's"
"Stands for Android Development Tools, these tools help you create, debug, and compile your program "
"Stands for Dalvik Debug Monitor Server, this tool is used to debug processes"
"The logcat records many things that happen on your device"
"Panels refer to the gui and how its comprised of different panels."
"The toolbar is the icons on the top of the screen that act as shortcuts to functions in the program"
"Tells you the status of android studio, or a process currently running(compiling/ etc)"
"Lets you see what the Program will look like without compiling"
"Lets you delve into the projects files on a per folder basis "
"Gives you possible statements depending on what you type, basically intelligently senses what youâ€™re probably gonna need to type"
"Modules in Android Studio act like projects in Eclipse, due to how android studio handles multiple projects"
"Is similar to the preview pane and lets you see the layout in real time"
